00056 /*****************************************************************************\
00057  * NOTICE OF CONVENTION                                                      *
00058  * ------------------------------------------------------------------------- *
00059  * Mspec links to Pcode, Hcode, and Lcode modules.  In order to allow this   *
00060  * to take place without requiring front-end modules to link to liblcode.a,  *
00061  * Mspec code is divided into two classes as follows:                        *
00062  *  - mi_*.c must not depend on linkage to liblcode.a                        *
00063  *  - ml_*.c may depend on linkage to liblcode.a                             *
00064 \*****************************************************************************/
00065 
00066 /* 10/29/02 REK Adding config.h */
00067 #include <config.h>
00068 #include <Lcode/l_main.h>
00069 #include <machine/m_spec.h>
00070 #include <machine/m_hpl_pd.h>
00071 #include <machine/m_hppa.h>
00072 #include <machine/m_sparc.h>
00073 
00074 /*
00075  *  5-20-95
00076  *      Playdoh currently supports 3 models:
00077  *      1. v1-hp - Playdoh instruction set; with HP calling convention,
00078  *              parameter passing macros, data layout, stack layout, etc.
00079  *              Thus you can feed HP Lcode to playdoh but NOT HP Mcode (ie,
00080  *              code run thru phase1 of Lhppa).
00081  *      2. v1-sun - Playdoh instruction set; with Sparc calling convention,
00082  *              parameter passing macros, data layout, stack layout, etc.
00083  *              Thus you can feed Sparc Lcode to playdoh but 
00084  *              NOT Sparc Mcode (ie, code run thru phase1 of Lsparc).
00085  *      3. v1.0 - This is purely configurable to any sort of 
00086  *              calling convention, data layout, stack layout that you desire.
00087  *              Currently it it is set up identical to HP-PA because we don't  
00088  *              have much originality.  Also the emulator operates on an HP 
00089  *              or Sparc, so if you ever want the code to run, you best use 
00090  *              one of those 2 platforms.
00091  *      If you have questions talk to Rick or Scott.
00092  *
00093  *  12-04
00094  *      Only the last model (v1.0) is currently supported
00095  */
00096 
00097 /* model compiling for, internal to this Mspec only */
00098 int M_playdoh_model;
00099 
00100 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00101 #define M_PLAYDOH_SIZE_VOID     0
00102 #define M_PLAYDOH_SIZE_BIT      1
00103 #define M_PLAYDOH_SIZE_CHAR     8
00104 #define M_PLAYDOH_SIZE_SHORT    16
00105 #define M_PLAYDOH_SIZE_INT      32
00106 #define M_PLAYDOH_SIZE_LONG     32
00107 #define M_PLAYDOH_SIZE_FLOAT    32
00108 #define M_PLAYDOH_SIZE_DOUBLE   64
00109 #define M_PLAYDOH_SIZE_POINTER  32
00110 #define M_PLAYDOH_SIZE_LLONG    64
00111 #define M_PLAYDOH_SIZE_UNION    -1
00112 #define M_PLAYDOH_SIZE_STRUCT   -1
00113 #define M_PLAYDOH_SIZE_BLOCK    -1
00114 #define M_PLAYDOH_SIZE_MAX      64
00115 
00116 #define M_PLAYDOH_ALIGN_VOID    -1
00117 #define M_PLAYDOH_ALIGN_BIT     1
00118 #define M_PLAYDOH_ALIGN_CHAR    8
00119 #define M_PLAYDOH_ALIGN_SHORT   16
00120 #define M_PLAYDOH_ALIGN_INT     32
00121 #define M_PLAYDOH_ALIGN_LONG    32
00122 #define M_PLAYDOH_ALIGN_FLOAT   32
00123 #define M_PLAYDOH_ALIGN_DOUBLE  64
00124 #define M_PLAYDOH_ALIGN_POINTER 32
00125 #define M_PLAYDOH_ALIGN_LLONG   64
00126 #define M_PLAYDOH_ALIGN_UNION   -1      /* depends on the field */
00127 #define M_PLAYDOH_ALIGN_STRUCT  -1
00128 #define M_PLAYDOH_ALIGN_BLOCK   -1
00129 #define M_PLAYDOH_ALIGN_MAX     64
00130 
00131 int
00132 M_playdoh_type_size (int mtype)
00133 {
00134   if (M_playdoh_model == M_PLAYDOH_V1)
00135     {
00136       switch (mtype)
00137         {
00138         case M_TYPE_VOID:
00139           return M_PLAYDOH_SIZE_VOID;
00140         case M_TYPE_BIT_LONG:
00141         case M_TYPE_BIT_LLONG:
00142         case M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR:
00143         case M_TYPE_BIT_SHORT:
00144         case M_TYPE_BIT_INT:
00145           return M_PLAYDOH_SIZE_BIT;
00146         case M_TYPE_CHAR:
00147           return M_PLAYDOH_SIZE_CHAR;
00148         case M_TYPE_SHORT:
00149           return M_PLAYDOH_SIZE_SHORT;
00150         case M_TYPE_INT:
00151           return M_PLAYDOH_SIZE_INT;
00152         case M_TYPE_LONG:
00153           return M_PLAYDOH_SIZE_LONG;
00154         case M_TYPE_LLONG:
00155           return M_PLAYDOH_SIZE_LLONG;
00156         case M_TYPE_FLOAT:
00157           return M_PLAYDOH_SIZE_FLOAT;
00158         case M_TYPE_DOUBLE:
00159           return M_PLAYDOH_SIZE_DOUBLE;
00160         case M_TYPE_POINTER:
00161           return M_PLAYDOH_SIZE_POINTER;
00162         case M_TYPE_UNION:
00163           return M_PLAYDOH_SIZE_UNION;
00164         case M_TYPE_STRUCT:
00165           return M_PLAYDOH_SIZE_STRUCT;
00166         case M_TYPE_BLOCK:
00167           return M_PLAYDOH_SIZE_BLOCK;
00168         default:
00169           return -1;
00170         }
00171     }
00172   else
00173     {
00174       M_assert (0, "M_playdoh_type_size: illegal machine model");
00175       return (0);
00176     }
00177 
00178 }
00179 
00180 int
00181 M_playdoh_type_align (int mtype)
00182 {
00183   if (M_playdoh_model == M_PLAYDOH_V1)
00184     {
00185       switch (mtype)
00186         {
00187         case M_TYPE_VOID:
00188           return M_PLAYDOH_ALIGN_VOID;
00189         case M_TYPE_BIT_LONG:
00190           return M_PLAYDOH_ALIGN_BIT;
00191         case M_TYPE_BIT_SHORT:
00192           return M_PLAYDOH_ALIGN_BIT;
00193         case M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR:
00194           return M_PLAYDOH_ALIGN_BIT;
00195         case M_TYPE_CHAR:
00196           return M_PLAYDOH_ALIGN_CHAR;
00197         case M_TYPE_SHORT:
00198           return M_PLAYDOH_ALIGN_SHORT;
00199         case M_TYPE_INT:
00200           return M_PLAYDOH_ALIGN_INT;
00201         case M_TYPE_LONG:
00202           return M_PLAYDOH_ALIGN_LONG;
00203         case M_TYPE_LLONG:
00204           return M_PLAYDOH_ALIGN_LLONG;
00205         case M_TYPE_FLOAT:
00206           return M_PLAYDOH_ALIGN_FLOAT;
00207         case M_TYPE_DOUBLE:
00208           return M_PLAYDOH_ALIGN_DOUBLE;
00209         case M_TYPE_POINTER:
00210           return M_PLAYDOH_ALIGN_POINTER;
00211         case M_TYPE_UNION:
00212           return M_PLAYDOH_ALIGN_UNION;
00213         case M_TYPE_STRUCT:
00214           return M_PLAYDOH_ALIGN_STRUCT;
00215         case M_TYPE_BLOCK:
00216           return M_PLAYDOH_ALIGN_BLOCK;
00217         default:
00218           return -1;
00219         }
00220     }
00221   else
00222     {
00223       M_assert (0, "M_playdoh_type_align: illegal machine model");
00224       return (0);
00225     }
00226 }
00227 
00228 /*
00229  *      The following functions are for documentation only.
00230  *      The function overhead is too great for actual usage.
00231  */
00232 void
00233 M_playdoh_bit_llong (M_Type type, int n)
00234 {
00235   type->type = M_TYPE_BIT_LLONG;
00236   type->unsign = 1;
00237   type->align = M_PLAYDOH_ALIGN_BIT;
00238   type->size = n * M_PLAYDOH_SIZE_BIT;
00239   type->nbits = n * M_PLAYDOH_SIZE_BIT;
00240   M_assert ((n <= 64),
00241             "M_bit_long: do not allow bit field of more than 64 bits");
00242 }
00243 
00244 void
00245 M_playdoh_char (M_Type type, int unsign)
00246 {
00247   if (M_playdoh_model == M_PLAYDOH_V1)
00248     {
00249       type->type = M_TYPE_CHAR;
00250       type->unsign = (unsign != 0);
00251       type->align = M_PLAYDOH_ALIGN_CHAR;
00252       type->size = M_PLAYDOH_SIZE_CHAR;
00253       type->nbits = M_PLAYDOH_SIZE_CHAR;
00254     }
00255   else
00256     {
00257       M_assert (0, "M_playdoh_char: illegal machine model");
00258     }
00259 }
00260 
00261 void
00262 M_playdoh_short (M_Type type, int unsign)
00263 {
00264   if (M_playdoh_model == M_PLAYDOH_V1)
00265     {
00266       type->type = M_TYPE_SHORT;
00267       type->unsign = (unsign !=0);
00268       type->align = M_PLAYDOH_ALIGN_SHORT;
00269       type->size = M_PLAYDOH_SIZE_SHORT;
00270       type->nbits = M_PLAYDOH_SIZE_SHORT;
00271     }
00272   else
00273     {
00274       M_assert (0, "M_playdoh_short: illegal machine model");
00275     }
00276 }
00277

00279 M_playdoh_int (M_Type type, int unsign)

00283       type->type = M_TYPE_INT;

00289   else

00292     }

00296 M_playdoh_long (M_Type type, int unsign)

00300       type->type = M_TYPE_LONG;
00301       type->unsign = (unsign != 0);
00302       type->align = M_PLAYDOH_ALIGN_LONG;
00303       type->size = M_PLAYDOH_SIZE_LONG;

00313 void
00314 M_playdoh_llong (M_Type type, int unsign)
00315 {
00316   type->type = M_TYPE_LLONG;
00317   type->unsign = unsign;
00318   type->align = M_PLAYDOH_ALIGN_LLONG;
00319   type->size = M_PLAYDOH_SIZE_LLONG;
00320   type->nbits = M_PLAYDOH_SIZE_LLONG;
00321 }
00322 
00323 
00324 int
00325 M_playdoh_layout_order (void)
00326 {
00327   if (M_playdoh_model == M_PLAYDOH_V1)
00328     {
00329       if (M_read_database_i ("_HT__info", "little_endian", "value") == 1)
00330         {
00331           return M_LITTLE_ENDIAN;
00332         }
00333       else
00334         {
00335           return M_BIG_ENDIAN;
00336         }
00337 
00338       // Made consistent with Lcode model for impact architecture
00339       //      return M_BIG_ENDIAN;
00340     }
00341   else
00342     {
00343       M_assert (0, "M_playdoh_layout_order: illegal machine model");
00344       return (0);
00345     }
00346 }
00347 
00348 void
00349 M_set_model_playdoh (char *model_name)
00350 {
00351   if (!strcasecmp (model_name, "V1.0") ||
00352       !strcasecmp (model_name, "V1.1"))
00353     {
00354       M_model = M_PLAYDOH_V1;
00355       M_playdoh_model = M_PLAYDOH_V1;
00356 
00357       // Made consistent with Lcode model for impact architecture
00358       /* Use the layout database to answer as many queries as possible */
00359       M_use_layout_database = 0;
00360     }
00361   else
00362     {
00363       fprintf (stderr, "illegal model_name : %s\n", model_name);
00364       fprintf (stderr,
00365                "Use one of the following: V1.0, V1.1, V1-HP, V1-SUN\n");
00366       M_assert (0, "M_set_model_impact: illegal model name specified");
00367     }
00368 }
